triples.name: Unmanned surface vehicle
triples.relevance: The paper focuses on formation control of multiple unmanned surface vehicles (MUSVs) for autonomous water-based operations.

triples.name: Deadband
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a dynamic deadband intermittent event-triggered mechanism as a novel control strategy.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: The paper applies control theory principles to achieve formation control and consensus in multi-agent systems.

triples.name: Consensus (computer science)
triples.relevance: The paper transforms formation control into consensus achievement of auxiliary variables across multiple vehicles.

triples.name: Radial basis function network
triples.relevance: The paper utilizes radial basis function neural networks (RBFNN) to handle dynamic uncertainties and external disturbances.

triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: The paper employs adaptive control strategies to address model parametric uncertainties in the system.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses coordinated control of multiple autonomous vehicles operating as a distributed multi-agent system.

triples.name: Neural network (machine learning)
triples.relevance: Neural networks are used as part of the RBFNN approach for approximating and handling system uncertainties.
